meanings.definition: The harsh cry of a crow or similar bird.
meanings.sent1: The loud caw echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent2: I woke up to the caw of a crow outside my window.
meanings.sent3: The caw of the crow startled the squirrel, making it drop its acorn.
meanings.sent4: Amidst the silence, the caw of the crow pierced through like a sharp arrow.
meanings.sent5: The eerie caw of the crow sent shivers down my spine.

meanings.definition: To make the sound of a crow.
meanings.sent1: The crow will caw loudly in the morning.
meanings.sent2: I can hear the crow cawing in the distance.
meanings.sent3: I tried to caw like a crow, but it just sounded funny.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter cawed through the room, infectious and joyful.
meanings.sent5: The children cawed with delight as they played in the park.

meanings.definition: A sound resembling the cry of a crow.
meanings.sent1: The eerie caw of the wind sounded like a distant crow.
meanings.sent2: The old house made a strange caw in the night.
meanings.sent3: The rusty gate made a cawing noise every time it swung open.
meanings.sent4: The caw of the rusty hinges echoed through the empty barn.
meanings.sent5: The caw of the old car engine signaled its last breath.
